Module: iterator

iterator

Utilities around iterators.
Source:
  • iterator.js, line 109

Methods

<static> count(iterator, iterator)

Counts items in an iterator.

Each time the next method is called, property count of the iterator is updated with the current number of items already read. Once the iterator is finished, this counter represents the total number of items iterated on and no longer changes.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
iterator external:Iterator the original iterator to count items of.
iterator external:Iterator an iterator which elments will be counted.
Source:
  • iterator.js, line 136

<static> fromArray(array) → {external:Iterator}

Creates an iterator on an array.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
array Object[] the array of items to represent.
Source:
  • iterator.js, line 123
Returns:
an iterator which will provide items of the array.
Type
external:Iterator

<static> map(iterator, transform) → {external:Iterator}

Transforms values of an array.

Does the transformation synchronously when possible but handles promises returned by the upstream iterator. The transformer function can return promises too.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
iterator external:Iterator the original iterator to transform.
transform function the function transforming individual items.
Source:
  • iterator.js, line 149
Returns:
an iterator which will provide transformed items.
Type
external:Iterator
